description.narrative:
Newcom Group (NCG) is one of the largest investment holding conglomerates in Mongolia, with investments in the telecommunications, civil aviation, energy, and real estate sectors. NCGs flagship company, Mobicom Corporation, is the largest wireless service provider in Mongolia, with more than one million subscribers. NCG also enjoys a leadership position with Eznis, the largest private airline in Mongolia that operates flights to 14 domestic destinations and to Hailar, China and Ulan-Ude, Russia. In the renewable energy sector, NCG has already started developing the first wind power plant in Mongolia. With over 12 investments and portfolio companies, Newcom Group employs around 2,000 people.
The Project
The proposed project is to support NCGs expansion by helping finance the capital expenditure program of its subsidiary and affiliate companies over the next few years. NCGs contemplated expansions include a 50 MW wind park as well as further investments in the groups commercial airline and property management businesses.

The project is expected to: (i) help create additional jobs and promote entrepreneurship; (ii) contribute to increase the power generation capacity and tap into a renewable energy resource; (iii) reduce carbon emissions that would have been generated by alternative sources of electricity; (iv) provide access to health facilities; (v) support the development of mining and natural resources activities in Mongolia; and (vi) further contribute to Government tax income with expanded operations of NCG.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. B. Bold, Chief Executive Officer, Newcom LLC, 8F and 9F, 8 Zovkhis Building, Seoul street 21, Ulaanbaatar 14251, Mongolia Tel: 976-11-313183, 976-11-311967 Fax: 976-11-318521, 976-11-311969 E-mail: secretary@newcom.mn Website: www.newcom.mn

name.narrative: Newcom and its subsidiaries are headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. The proposed 50MW Salkhit wind project is located around the Salkhit Mountain and Shakhuugiin Khuviin Lake in Sergelen soum of Tov Aimag, about 70 Km south of Ulaanbaatar. The rest of the projects are expected to be located mainly in Ulaanbaatar.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
